result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding   
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntarily made, Court finds a factual basis & finds the defendant guilty  

Adjourned: 3:04 p.m.
Plea/Sentencing set for 09/20/22 - address provided by the post office is the Portage County Jail

8/17/2022 Bond is amended with conditions as follows: 
No contact with the victims and that includes in writing, electronic or any other means: J.A.I., R.M., T.I., and any other named victims.  
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

11:05 AM Prosecuting attorney Robert J Jambois appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lyle C Roeder appeared by video.  Attorney William George Weiland appeared by video for Lyle C Roeder. 

All files heard: 20CM219, 20CM288, 21CF137, 21CF329, 21CF525, 21CM114, 21CM156, 22CF110, 22CF111, 22CF239, 22CM44
Atty Jambois states the appearances. 
Court states there is concern for today's hearing, there are no elements of the crime listed in any of the cases on the plea questionnaire.  The court notes these should be attached to the plea questionnaire.  Because of the number of charges and pleas to felonies, the court wants that in writing so there is a good record that those were gone over with the defendant.  
Defendant states Atty Weiland did speak to him about this this morning.   He is in agreement to the plea deal and understands the elements of the charges.  
Court questions Atty Jambois. 
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes. 
Atty Weiland states if a new court date would be set, then he will move to modify the bond. 
Court would like documentation of the written elements on the plea questionnaire.  
Atty Weiland makes statements. 
Atty Jambois makes statements.  22CM44 will be the case that he will received time served.  Would stipulate to signature bond on remaining charges. 
Court questions Atty Weiland regarding stating the elements on the record for each of the counts. 
Atty Jambois does not object to being rescheduled and a signature bond in all pending cases.  
Clerk questions if victims are given zoom information. 
Atty Jambois confirms they are.  No victims are present.  Makes arguments regarding bond. 
Atty Weiland does not object. 

BY THE COURT: 
$500 signature bond on each case:
Condition:
No contact with the victims and that includes in writing, electronic or any other means: J.A.I., R.M., T.I., and any other named victims.  
Maintain absolute sobriety. 
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Court addresses the defendant following the bond and conditions of bond.  Questions if he understands that he is not to have contact with J.A.I.  
Defendant states he understands that. 

BY THE COURT: 
Atty Weiland is to provide the elements in writing in each file. 

Atty Weiland informs the defendant to contact him when he is released with his address and phone number and also provide that to the Clerk of Courts office.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea Hearing set for 08/17/22 - not deliverable as addressed
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 17, 2022 at 11:00 am.

Judge Rick Cveykus assigned

records.addlTxt:
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes. 
Victim is not present. 

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:13 PM Defendant Lyle C Roeder appeared by video, in custody from the Waupaca County jail.  Attorney William George Weiland in court for Lyle C Roeder.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Atty Cassidy calls the case and states the appearances. 
Atty Weiland makes statements.  Defendant wishes to waive his right to a preliminary hearing. 
Court questions the defendant. 
Defendant confirms he wishes to waive the preliminary hearing. 

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant's attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.
Bond continued.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

2:21 PM Defendant Lyle C Roeder appeared by video, in custody at the Portage County Jail.   Attorney William George Weiland in court for Lyle C Roeder.  Attorney Brian Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 5, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Filed by the State:  Request to re-scheduled from 1:15 p.m. on 06/06/22 to 2:15 p.m. on 06/06/22 
Request to move AIA today from 1:15 to today at 2:15 due to conflict with Defense attorney calendar.

1:34 PM Defendant Lyle C Roeder appeared by video, in custody.   Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Defendant waives reading of the complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.
Defendant makes statements on the record.
Court questions the $15,000 cash bond and the defendant responds.
Defendant would like a lower cash bond.
ADA Cassidy would like to add to the reasons as to why the cash bond was set at $15,000 and she states why it was set so high.
Defendant responds to statements of ADA Cassidy.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued. 
Defendant is informed to get in contact with the public defender's office.
Court will not amend the bond today as it is a Branch 2 case.

Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 6, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Initial Appearance set for May 23, 2022 @ 1:15 p.m. in Br 1

(Corrected bond amount)
Bond covers 22GF204 and 22CM44.
Follow all open bond conditions.
No contact with J.I. or her residence.

1:08 PM Debtor Lyle C Roeder appeared by video, in custody.  Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of WI. Attorney (Atty) Taylor Soule is present in court.
ADA Cassidy states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping. 
Atty Soule does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Defendant is eligible for public defender.
State requests a cash bond with conditions as stated. 
Atty Soule's objections are heard as to bond and requests a signature bond or a lower cash bond.
Adjourned order to show cause hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
